intro: Aspilia silphioides f. major, commonly known as the large-flowered aspilia, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange disc flowers surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. It has a robust root system and produces numerous flowering stems that rise from the base. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
